Anonymous. AFFIDAVITS. Scott,

asked the court, whether when one party obtains a rule for taking affidavits, that rule is a sufficient warrant to authorize the other party to take affidavits also ?

The Chief Justice said, the practice is, when a general rule is obtained by one party to take affidavits for a specific purpose, then both parties have leave, by virtue of the rule, to take affidavits.
